org.fujion.highcharts

Class ExportingOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.highcharts.ExportingOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter, IClientTransform

    public class ExportingOptions
extends Options
    Options for the exporting module.

    • Field Detail

      • buttons_exportButton

        @Option(value="buttons.exportButton")
public final ButtonOptions buttons_exportButton
        Options for the export button.

      • buttons_printButton

        @Option(value="buttons.printButton")
public final ButtonOptions buttons_printButton
        Options for the print button.

      • enabled

        @Option
public Boolean enabled
        Whether to enable the exporting module. Defaults to true.

      • error

        @Option(convertTo=JavaScript.class)
public String error
        Function to call if the offline-exporting module fails to export a chart on the client side, and fallbackToExportServer is disabled. If left undefined, an exception is thrown instead. Defaults to undefined.

      • fallbackToExportServer

        @Option
public Boolean fallbackToExportServer
        Whether or not to fall back to the export server if the offline-exporting module is unable to export the chart on the client side. Defaults to true.

      • filename

        @Option
public String filename
        The filename, without extension, to use for the exported chart. Defaults to "chart".

      • printMaxWidth

        @Option
public Integer printMaxWidth
        When printing the chart from the menu item in the burger menu, if the on-screen chart exceeds this width, it is resized. After printing or cancelled, it is restored. The default width makes the chart fit into typical paper format. Note that this does not affect the chart when printing the web page as a whole. Defaults to 780.

      • scale

        @Option
public Integer scale
        Defines the scale or zoom factor for the exported image compared to the on-screen display. While for instance a 600px wide chart may look good on a website, it will look bad in print. The default scale of 2 makes this chart export to a 1200px PNG or JPG. Defaults to 2.

      • showTable

        @Option
public Boolean showTable
        Export-data module required. Show a HTML table below the chart with the chart's current data. Defaults to false.

      • sourceHeight

        @Option
public Integer sourceHeight
        The height of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.height is set. The height exported raster image is then multiplied by scale. Defaults to undefined.

      • sourceWidth

        @Option
public Integer sourceWidth
        The width of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.width is set. The width exported raster image is then multiplied by scale. Defaults to undefined.

      • tableCaption

        @Option
public String tableCaption
        Export-data module required. Caption for the data table. Same as chart title by default. Set to empty string to disable. Defaults to undefined.

      • type

        @Option
public ExportType type
        Default MIME type for exporting if chart.exportChart() is called without specifying a type option. Possible values are image/png, image/jpeg, application/pdf and image/svg+xml. Defaults to "image/png".

      • url

        @Option
public String url
        The URL for the server module converting the SVG string to an image format. By default this points to Highchart's free web service. Defaults to https://export.highcharts.com/.

      • useMultiLevelHeaders

        @Option
public Boolean useMultiLevelHeaders
        Export-data module required. Use multi level headers in data table. If csv.columnHeaderFormatter is defined, it has to return objects in order for multi level headers to work. Defaults to true.

      • useRowspanHeaders

        @Option
public Boolean useRowspanHeaders
        Export-data module required. If using multi level table headers, use rowspans for headers that have only one level. Defaults to true.

      • width

        @Option
public Integer width
        The pixel width of charts exported to PNG or JPG. The default pixel width is a function of the chart.width or exporting.sourceWidth and the exporting.scale.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExportingOptions

        public ExportingOptions()
